issues.description: The problem statement contains a contradictory specification for the milk method. The UML and multiple parts of the statement describe a no-argument messageOnMilk(): String (e.g., interface definition in the UML), and the template/solution expect and use messageOnMilk() without parameters. However, Part 2 of the textual instructions (line(s) 92-95) asks for messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) and specifies a return string including the volume. This parameterized signature conflicts with the UML, the template usage in Main (which calls messageOnMilk() with no args), and the solution (Milkable, Goat, Seal) which all define messageOnMilk() with no parameter. Students could be confused about which signature to implement; implementing the parameterized version will not match the template/solution and likely fail tests or the provided Main usage.
issues.suggested_fix: Resolve the contradiction by choosing one signature and aligning all artifacts. Preferred (minimal change): update the problem statement Part 2 to specify messageOnMilk() with no parameters and adjust the described return format to "[Animal Type] [name] is milked" (or similar without volume). Alternatively, if the intention is to teach parameterized methods, update the template and solution to declare Milkable.messageOnMilk(double milkVolume), update all implementations (Seal, Goat) and all call sites (Main, tests) to pass a double, and update the UML to show messageOnMilk(double): String.

issues.description: The problem statement (Part 2) requires a method messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) that includes a double parameter and returns a string containing the volume, but the template and solution repositories (and the UML earlier in the problem) define and use a parameterless messageOnMilk() method. This mismatch in the method signature (parameter presence) creates a mapping/confusion problem: students reading the textual requirement may implement messageOnMilk(double) while the provided template/expected implementations and tests use messageOnMilk() with no parameter, leading to compilation errors or failing overrides and extra cognitive load to resolve which signature is correct.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the method signature across artifacts. Prefer updating the problem statement to match the UML/template/solution: require a parameterless messageOnMilk() that returns a string like "[Animal Type] [name] is milked" (remove the double milkVolume parameter and the volume text). Alternatively, if the intent is to track milk volume, update the UML, template Main, Milkable interface, and all implementations to use messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) and update all call sites (e.g., m.messageOnMilk(volume)). The simpler/less invasive fix is to change the problem text to specify messageOnMilk() with the return format used in the template/solution.
